detaileddescription.para: Never show scroll bars
Always show scroll bars
Show scroll bars when page is being dragged
Show scroll bars when the scrollable container is large enough to be scrolled
Hide the scroll bar temporally
Unhide the previously hidden scroll bar. Recover original mode too
Scrollbar modes: shows when should the scrollbars be visible
Edges: describes the four edges of the page

Create a page objects
par
pointer to an object, it will be the parent of the new page
copy
pointer to a page object, if not NULL then the new object will be copied from it
pointer to the created page

Delete all children of the scrl object, without deleting scrl child.
page
pointer to an object

Get the scrollable object of a page
page
pointer to a page object
pointer to a container which is the scrollable part of the page

Get the animation time
page
pointer to a page object
the animation time in milliseconds

Set the scroll bar mode on a page
page
pointer to a page object
sb_mode
the new mode from 'lv_page_sb.mode_t' enum

Set the animation time for the page
page
pointer to a page object
anim_time
animation time in milliseconds

Enable the scroll propagation feature. If enabled then the page will move its parent if there is no more space to scroll. The page needs to have a page-like parent (e.g. lv_page, lv_tabview tab, lv_win content area etc) If enabled drag direction will be changed LV_DRAG_DIR_ONE automatically to allow scrolling only in one direction at one time.
page
pointer to a Page
en
true or false to enable/disable scroll propagation

Enable the edge flash effect. (Show an arc when the an edge is reached)
page
pointer to a Page
en
true or false to enable/disable end flash

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *page, lv_fit_t left, lv_fit_t right, lv_fit_t top, lv_fit_t bottom)
memberdef.name: lv_page_set_scrl_fit4

detaileddescription.para:
Set the fit policy in all 4 directions separately. It tell how to change the page size automatically.
page
pointer to a page object
left
left fit policy from lv_fit_t
right
right fit policy from lv_fit_t
top
bottom fit policy from lv_fit_t
bottom
bottom fit policy from lv_fit_t

Set the fit policy horizontally and vertically separately. It tell how to change the page size automatically.
page
pointer to a page object
hot
horizontal fit policy from lv_fit_t
ver
vertical fit policy from lv_fit_t

Set the fit policyin all 4 direction at once. It tell how to change the page size automatically.
page
pointer to a button object
fit
fit policy from lv_fit_t

Set width of the scrollable part of a page
page
pointer to a page object
w
the new width of the scrollable (it ha no effect is horizontal fit is enabled)

Set height of the scrollable part of a page
page
pointer to a page object
h
the new height of the scrollable (it ha no effect is vertical fit is enabled)

Set the layout of the scrollable part of the page
page
pointer to a page object
layout
a layout from 'lv_cont_layout_t'

Set the scroll bar mode on a page
page
pointer to a page object
the mode from 'lv_page_sb.mode_t' enum

Get the scroll propagation property
page
pointer to a Page
true or false

Get the edge flash effect property.
page
pointer to a Page return true or false

Get that width which can be set to the children to still not cause overflow (show scrollbars)
page
pointer to a page object
the width which still fits into the page

Get that height which can be set to the children to still not cause overflow (show scrollbars)
page
pointer to a page object
the height which still fits into the page

Divide the width of the object and get the width of a given number of columns. Take into account the paddings of the background and scrollbale too.
page
pointer to an object
div
indicates how many columns are assumed. If 1 the width will be set the the parent's width If 2 only half parent width - inner padding of the parent If 3 only third parent width - 2 * inner padding of the parent
span
how many columns are combined
the width according to the given parameters

Divide the height of the object and get the width of a given number of columns. Take into account the paddings of the background and scrollbale too.
page
pointer to an object
div
indicates how many rows are assumed. If 1 the height will be set the the parent's height If 2 only half parent height - inner padding of the parent If 3 only third parent height - 2 * inner padding of the parent
span
how many rows are combined
the height according to the given parameters

Get width of the scrollable part of a page
page
pointer to a page object
the width of the scrollable

Get height of the scrollable part of a page
page
pointer to a page object
the height of the scrollable

Get the layout of the scrollable part of a page
page
pointer to page object
the layout from 'lv_cont_layout_t'

Get the left fit mode
page
pointer to a page object
an element of lv_fit_t

Get the right fit mode
page
pointer to a page object
an element of lv_fit_t

Get the top fit mode
page
pointer to a page object
an element of lv_fit_t

Get the bottom fit mode
page
pointer to a page object
an element of lv_fit_t

Find whether the page has been scrolled to a certain edge.
page
Page object
edge
Edge to check
true if the page is on the specified edge

Glue the object to the page. After it the page can be moved (dragged) with this object too.
obj
pointer to an object on a page
glue
true: enable glue, false: disable glue

Focus on an object. It ensures that the object will be visible on the page.
page
pointer to a page object
obj
pointer to an object to focus (must be on the page)
anim_en
LV_ANIM_ON to focus with animation; LV_ANIM_OFF to focus without animation

Scroll the page horizontally
page
pointer to a page object
dist
the distance to scroll (< 0: scroll left; > 0 scroll right)

Scroll the page vertically
page
pointer to a page object
dist
the distance to scroll (< 0: scroll down; > 0 scroll up)

Not intended to use directly by the user but by other object types internally. Start an edge flash animation.
page
edge
the edge to flash. Can be LV_PAGE_EDGE_LEFT/RIGHT/TOP/BOTTOM
